channel.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
channel.description:
http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2013/mar/29/north-korea-attack-us-what-happens-next
[youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kj0NTZon7kc[/youtube]
What do you think will happen? Will North Korea attack the United States? I hope they won't.

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Doesn’t matter, the oil companies are privatized. The right wing party has proposed state-owned inland/offshore drilling to bring in more revenue but the democrats turned it down.

Read full topic

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

A bunch of countries are buying them directly from Lockheed Martin at the same price US will pay for them. So there isn’t much money in resale. And US will keep a majority of them for themselves.

True we earn a lot of money from oil and gas. That is because the government own (The majority of the shares) the biggest oil company in Norway, and the oil companies here must pay 78% in taxes. How much does American oil companies pay?

If you want to make money on planes, you have to build them yourself and sell them. You can’t just buy them from a private company and hope you can sell them for more money.

Read full topic

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:114, topic:514719”]What do you need the jets for? (US have actually ordered 2400 jets for over $100 million per jet) Invade yet another country?

Or you could prevent people from dying, and keep them as tax payers.[/quote]
Just to have them. You put a bunch of people to work for years to get them built and you also keep your military supply up. Not only that but we can then sell them to other countries. Prevent people from dying? It must be nice that Norway can export all those natural resources to pay for it.

I forgot what the 4 were jme, it was like defense, foreign policy, commerce or something and then there was one other one but it wasn’t the postal service lol (but that may have been included within one of the 4)

Read full topic

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:113, topic:514719”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=632968.msg4292054#msg4292054 date=1367477117]

Because we don’t really have a shortage of those lol

You don’t have shortage of military personnel either, it is in fact too many. Hire more teachers to improve your country’s education system, more teachers are better. Hire more police officers to reduce the amount of crimes in crime ridden cities.
[/quote]
What? The money on the military isn’t spent just on just recruits.

Ordering 15 jets puts thousands of people to work and can also bring alot of technological advancements

What they need to do is move social security and the other federally funded entitlement programs to the STATE level to free up the federal budget. Our federal government is only supposed to do 4 things, so 1/4 of the budget going to military is completely normal. The state governments are supposed to handle social policies because they can tune it to be more/less supportive depending on what the state needs[/quote]

By your logic, 1/4 of the budget should go towards running a postal service? (unless it already is, in which case >.>)

It’s not that I disagree with you. Because how you describe it is almost identical to Canada. All social programs like Education, Healthcare, and Welfare are the responsibility of the provinces. That being said, these programs do receive money from the federal government, but are funded mainly by provincial taxes.

Read full topic

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:103, topic:514719”][quote author=Frell link=topic=632968.msg4291602#msg4291602 date=1367370379]

Anyone who thinks North Korea could actually beat the USA, Is clearly a terrorist okay? The USA is the greatest, strongest, county in the world. No one can stop us, from out gay men who watch football, to our straight men who like Glee, We the best, number 1, on top, never gonna drop!

And if you don’t like America, or aren’t American. Than you don’t like God there for you will burn in hell. Sorry that’s just how it is.

We all know that Great Britain is the greatest, why else would it be called Great Britain?
You can’t even pay for your own military equipment We all know that the Russian and Chinese military is the strongest.

we pay for our own military. Not our own social welfare though because its flawed and wont be fixed
[/quote]
I like how you pick what you can afford, and what the borrowed money pays for. The US military spending is bloated, that is a fact. People have paid into social security and people need it.[/quote]
The military creates way more jobs than social welfare ever will. But yes people need it, but neither party is willing to fix the holes in it so it continues to be the biggest black hole of our spending.

Read full topic

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Sibor:

Why does everyone hate on America? We’re the ones keeping everything in the world from crashing!

A lot of people hate America because of how ignorant most Americans are… We don’t keep everything in the world from crashing, which should be a given obvious, because there are still a lot of places that are in still victimized due to corruption, mainly due because we have no right or reasoning to interfere. America’s biggest problem is that we always have to invade every other country’s privacy.

I’m sure that it is quite clear to everyone that America is a strong nation, but it surely isn’t the same nation it was years ago.

Read full topic

item.title: "North Korea vs. U.S.A"?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

RevengePK:

In this day and age when it comes to WMD’s, chemical warfare, and interstellar missles I think it boils down to technology. Whoever has more advanced technology is more likely to “win” persay. On the note of America just looking to find ways to deploy B-2’s, I don’t think this is valid, if we were just looking for a fight we would not have prolonged the testing of the Minuteman III, which we stalled so no one would think we were launching.

2 billion USD / B2
I’d look for an excuse to launch them too. If I was a pilot of a B-2 I’d get impatient aswell.

Read full topic
